actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: Joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide 4-year terms for Members of the House of Representatives and to limit the number of consecutive terms that Representatives and Senators may serve.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Provides that the term of office for a Member of the House of Representatives shall be four years. Limits to three the number of consecutive terms a Member may serve in the House and Senate.

titles.title: Joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide 4-year terms for Members of the House of Representatives and to limit the number of consecutive terms that Representatives and Senators may serve.
